Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Master \Mas"ter\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Mastered}; p. pr. vb. n. {Mastering}.] 1. To become the master of; to subject to one's will, control, or authority; to conquer; to overpower; to subdue. [1913 Webster]
Obstinacy and willful neglects must be mastered, even though it cost blows. --Locke. [1913 Webster]
2. To gain the command of, so as to understand or apply; to become an adept in; as, to master a science. [1913 Webster]
3. To own; to posses. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
The wealth That the world masters. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
mastered \mastered\ adj. Learned thoroughly.
Syn: down, down pat(predicate). [WordNet 1.5]
mastered adj : understood perfectly; "had his algebra problems down" [syn: {down}, {down pat(p)}]
